Automatically Scan and allow the user to select a sensor


In this experiment we shall use a user input block which scans the I2C port for supported sensors, and shows the user a list of detected sensors to select from.


The parameters supported by the selected Sensor are automatically fed into the adjacent drop-down menu for the user to select.


connections for I2C sensors


Sensors which use the I2C communication interface require 4 connections to be made.

  • VCC ( Can be 5V or 3.3V). The 4 wire sensor cable has 5V, and most commonly available sensors have a 3.3V regulator on board to convert the voltage .
  • GND . Ground
  • SCl. Clock pin. Internally pulled up to 3.3V via 10K resistor
  • SDA . Data . Internally pulled up to 3.3V via 10K

*If the sensor chip itself operates at 5V(INA219, some boards of QMC5883L etc), the pull up should be to 5V , or else communication errors will occur. To do this, connect a 2K resistor each from SCL to 5V, and from SDA to 5V (this can be done on the SCL,SDA,5V pins located at the top right side of the 40*2 connector of SEELab)
